lines.text:
[after failing to find his cousin in a phonebook]
Must've moved. Probably couldn't have heard him anyway, this goddamn ear's still bleedin'. Don't you ever try that shit again.
You were in the middle of threatening me.
[Phillip grabs the wheel as Butch turns to face Pugh in the back seat]
In two seconds, I'm gonna break your nose. That's a threat.
[Butch punches Pugh in the nose, then grabs the gun]
I'm gonna kill you for that.
And that's a threat. Beginning to understand the difference?

[after Butch has Phillip point a pistol at his face]
You're a fuckin' crazy man.
And that's a fact. I believe you're getting the hang of this.

[after Pugh snatches the car keys]
Why'd he take the keys?
You know, Phillip, you have a goddamned red, white and blue American right to eat cotton candy and ride roller coasters.
You know you did everything you could. Don't you?

[after getting kicked in the head by Butch]
I'm bleeding, you happy?

[Meeting his pursuer other face-to-face]
Do I know you, friend?
[after intimidating a woman into giving them supplies by flashing his gun]
Never underestimate the kindness of the common man, Phillip.

The idea is that an understanding of the particular behavioral case histories should, in parole situations, help the subject to avoid habitual traps and, in penal escape situations could, conversely, identify those self-same traps as an aid to apprehension.
Let me tell you something, Miss Gerber.
Let me tell you something, Sally. This is not a 'penal escape situation', this here happens to be a manhunt. And no talkin' in circles is gonna fix all that.
That's having a nose like a Blue Tick, pasa medulla, with an antenna and a helluva lot of coffee.

[interrupting a confrontation]
How you take your steak, Sally?
Well, I'll just wipe its ass, hurl it through and you can tear off a slab. How'd that be?
Hey, you ever ridden in a time machine before?
Well sure you have, what do you think this is?
You're looking at this thing bass-ackward, this is a twentieth century time machine. I'm the captain,
your the navigator. Now out there that's the future
[taps on the rear view mirror then points out the back windshield]
well that's the past. If life's moving too slow, you wanna project yourself into the future just step on the gas right here,
If you wanna slow her down, well hell you just step on the brake here and you slow her down.
This is the present Phillip, enjoy it while it lasts.
